headline: Turf War Unfolds Over Fannie and Freddie as Bessent and Pulte Clash
summary: The Trump administration is ramping up talks on what to do with mortgage giants Fannie Mae and  Freddie Mac  A fractious relationship between Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Bill  Pulte  who heads Fannie and Freddie’s regulator, could complicate the process.  This week, Treasury officials are convening representatives of major bond investors, lenders, consumer advocates, and other stakeholders on what to do with Fannie and Freddie, which together guarantee about $7 trillion in mortgage-backed securities.
